headline: Royal Caribbean Raises Dividend 50%: Is Cash Flow Strong Enough?
summary: RCL raises the quarterly dividend by 50% to $1.50, reflecting strong cash flow as firm cruise demand and bookings support growth plans.

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider Royal Caribbean Cruises (RCL) After Its Strong Multi‑Year Rally?
summary: If you are wondering whether Royal Caribbean Cruises is still good value after its recent run, this article will walk through what the current share price could imply about the business. The stock last closed at US$347.30, with returns of 6.4% over 7 days, 11.5% over 30 days, 22.6% year to date, 37.0% over 1 year, and very large gains over both 3 and 5 years. Recent attention on the cruise sector has been shaped by ongoing travel demand and investor focus on balance sheet resilience. Royal...

headline: I Tried Royal Caribbean’s New Beach Club but Passed on the Overpriced Cabana
summary: NASSAU, Bahamas—The 4,400 cruisers on  Royal Caribbean’s  Freedom of the Seas had plenty of options when the ship docked in the Bahamas Friday morning.  The excursion the cruise line touted the most, though, was a hot new beach club on a 17-acre sliver of Paradise Island.  It is the first stand-alone beach club for Royal Caribbean International, the company’s latest effort to capture a bigger share of passengers’ vacation dollars.
